title: Shakeer House / 3dor Concepts
description: Shakeer's residence exemplifies a harmonious synthesis of tropical modernist design with a deep sensitivity to its lush, verdant context. The architectural expression is defined by a low, horizontally oriented built form that nestles gently into the landscape, offering a seamless connection between the built and natural environment.
author: Miwa Negoro

title: Colombo Hebrew College / Aarón Cohen + Angélica Mejía + Camilo Sellamén + Camilo Fuentes + Joel Amón
description: The renovation of the Colegio Colombo Hebreo in Bogotá is the most ambitious project that the Jewish community has undertaken in the city of Bogotá in the last 40 years. After more than 70 years of organic growth without a defined master plan for its campus, a historic opportunity arose to rethink and project it for the next 50 years. The plan required the sale of almost a third of the land to finance the project, which necessitated a complete rethinking of the arrangement of the new buildings within the campus.
author: Valentina Díaz

title: Modern Living Meets Montreal’s History in a Striking Loft Transformation
description: In the heart of Montreal’s Plateau Mont-Royal, La Firme has redefined what it means to live within history. Their latest project, Elmire, transforms a 19th-century industrial building into a refined contemporary home. Formerly a textile mill and Campbell’s soup factory, the structure now celebrates modern life while honoring its industrial roots.
author: Erin

title: A Mid-Century Modern Home Reimagined for a Family in California
description: In the hills of Palo Alto, California, an iconic Eichler home has been respectfully transformed by architect-artist Gustave Carlson. Originally built in 1971 and custom-commissioned by architect John S. Lynd, a personal friend of Joseph Eichler, the home carries a rare pedigree among the region’s mid-century residences. Today, it belongs to a couple with four daughters and an expansive art collection, much of it by emerging female artists. Carlson’s thoughtful update bridges past and present, enhancing the home’s functionality while preserving its optimistic spirit.
author: Erin

title: The YMK Residence Brings Layered Living to the Karuizawa Highlands
description: Takeshi Hirobe Architects designs the YMK house in Karuizawa, Japan across six levels that follow its dramatically sloped, rural highland site.
author: Caroline Williamson

title: A Maui Home Blends Modern Minimalism With Climate-Conscious Design
description: A compact home in Maui by Hawaii Off Grid blends modern minimalism with climate-conscious design, featuring a sculptural roof and timber construction.
